question: Question_01_(e)
statement:
Calculate the volume of the solid obtained by rotating the region above
the \emph{x}-axis, below the curve $y = \frac{\sin x}{x}$ and between
the lines $x = \frac{\pi}{2}$ and $\displaystyle x = \pi$ about the
\emph{y}-axis.
sols:
To solve this question, choose an \emph{x} between $\pi/2$ and $\pi$.
From here, the radius of a shell rotated about the \emph{y}-axis is just
\emph{r} = \emph{x} and the height of this shell is
$\frac{\sin x}{x} - 0 = \frac{\sin x}{x}$. The distance the height
travels aroudn the \emph{y}-axis is $2\pi r$ and hence, we have

\begin{align*}
V &= \int_{\pi/2}^{\pi}2\pi(x)(\sin(x)/x)\,dx\\
&= \int_{\pi/2}^{\pi}2\pi\sin(x)\,dx\\
&= 2\pi(-\cos(x))\bigg|_{\pi/2}^{\pi} \\
&= 2\pi(-\cos(\pi) + \cos(\pi/2))\\
&= 2\pi(-(-1) + 0)\\
&= 2\pi
\end{align*}
hints: Use the method of cylindrical shells. (Shell Integration)
